intro: Conceveiba africana, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The plant's unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitats.
